comment: Class was easy but, professor was unclear on criteria for graded assignments.

Great professor in Entr 3001. Must do interviews on a possible business idea that you come up with. Talk with random strangers about the idea, doing good market research. Uses a program called EXEC which allows you to think outside the box. Be engaged! The class will go faster and easier!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Attendance wasn't taken and lectures don't contain material you need to do the work for the class. Heavy focus on excel. 3 Student Excel projects and several professor created projects. Professor created projects are difficult with vague instructions. He did not give us any grades on our work until we had finished every assignment for the semester

2.5 points extra credit points added onto your final grade if you go to all of the classes.  He does take roll. There is a classroom participation grade. Study guide is pretty much your test.  Practice the math questions because they WILL be on the test. End of the semester project.

He doesn't use the book EXCEPT the homework comes from the book.  Similar Homework questions will show up on the tests.  Fill out his STUDY GUIDES as he lectures and you'll ACE your tests. 2-person project that ties in a business decision and impact of a product of your choice on People, Profit and Planet. He makes up his own test questions!

He is very clear in the beginning of the semester. He is the boss and the students are the employees. This means he expects the work, but he is also understanding. Focus during his lectures, and take good notes from his examples; it is that simple. DO NOT OVERTHINK TESTS. All the math is what we learned from STATS. Great professor so take advantage

Not an easy class nor overly difficult. Requires a 20 page paper about where a product comes from. Main problem is that class is tedious. He'll try to elicit a response with a vague question like "what happened in Japan?". The class will come to the conclusion he wanted but it's frustrating how he beats the bush so often. 1/3 of class is app stat.

I had the 6:30pm MW class. Evening classes are SO hard to focus in, so make sure you take good notes. The first half hour is where all the valuable information is. You must go to class because the book won't help, though his lectures can get boring very fast. Participate and use the power points.

If you have common sense you will do fine in this class; if you don't... you will struggle.  Use your brain that's why you have one.  He makes the class fun and sometimes gets a little out of control, but you learn the material.  Skip class and you will regret it.

Come to class and take good notes. The book is only used a few times for homework assignments, but you do need it. In-class reviews before the test helped a lot. Tests were a little tricky, but process of elimination and common sense make the multiple choice section easy. Teaches you to actually apply knowledge. Group project was easy. Good teacher
He is vague on the project, but he tries to make it like a job assignment.  He gets off topic, but makes the class very interesting.  It's the first class that made me think.
Goes off topic every chance he gets lol! But he's hilarious and very smart. Tests are fairly easy. Come to class and take notes it'll save your life!

He is a very nice professor. If you need more structure he is not the professor but if you do not mind he is great because he does go off topic like someone else mentioned. He gives you every opportunity to get an A with easy extra credits so if you don't do well it is your own fault. He gave 1 midterm and final.

Professor was really nice. Did seem to get off topic all the time in lecture. He teaches like you should already know all the concepts studied in class, but this is an intro to management. I would take him again, but know that there is no direction and you'll be on your own a lot.

Dennis Loubiere is an excellent management professor. His classes are discussion-based that may seem off-topic at times but becomes relevant at the end of class. He will try to offend you, but its all in your best interest. Weekly discussions on D2L and connect assignments. 1 midterm and a final that are not difficult if you complete weekly work.

Class is a lot fun. Dennis is very laid back and makes learning about management interesting. One of those classes I learned a lot without putting in too much effort. Class is based on easy connect assignments and a midterm and final. Wish he was teaching more management classes at KSU but Fall 2013 was his 1st class. Definitely recommend!
